p: Four different samples of Allium vineale were collected from a field in Huntsville, Alabama (34°38′46″ N, 86°33′27″ W, 191 m elevation) on 10 April 2017, 8 a.m. Each sample was cleaned of debris, the entire plant (leaves and bulbs) chopped, and hydrodistilled using a Likens-Nickerson apparatus for 4 h with continuous extraction with dichloromethane (CH 2Cl 2). Evaporation of the dichloromethane yielded pale yellow essential oils with an extremely pungent odor ( Table 1).
